mdRecord.dcterms:title: Religion
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thompson, Ralph R.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From excerpt on photo: Members of the planning committee for Religious Emphasis Week at the University of Virginia confer with the Reverend John H. Fischbach, pastor of the Westminster Presbyterian Church at Charlottesville, chairman of the committee. Shown above, left to right, are Thomas S. Lodge, Lewes, Deleware, one of three student vice chairman; Mr. Fischbach, the Reverend Oscar W. Wooldridge, Jr., executive secretary of the University Y.M.C.A. and executive secretary of the committee; and James E. Kinard, Newberry, South Carolina, president of the Student Council, secretary; and Emmett W. Fontaine, Martinsville, Virginia, president of the University Union, treasurer. Religious Emphasis Week at the University begins Sunday, December 4.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
